section.name: Inputfield
section.p: An inputfield is a region in your browser where you are supposed to write something in. You do this by putting the mouse pointer in that region and then type characters with your keyboard.

Inputfields are generally small boxes, marked with a border and having a lighter background than the surroundings, usually white. This allows you to easily recognize that you are supposed to type something.
Of course, if you are supposed to write al lot in the inputfield, it will be larger.

It may happen that an inputfield has no border and has a background equal to the background of the surroundings. Because you are supposed to type something there, it is still an inputfield, but it is a badly decorated one.
